CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 6 displays the ln(JL 3 / V 2 ) vs ( V / L ) 0.5 curve for the measurement of the hole mobility of the blend films of PzNDTDTBT / PC71BM ( 1 : 2 , w / w ) and PzNDTDTBO / PC71BM ( 1.5 : 1 , w / w ) by the SCLC method.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph:

1. PzNDTDTBT
2. PC71BM
3. PzNDTDTBO
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph after removing the irrelevant entities:

1. PzNDTDTBT
2. PC71BM

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph as a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PzNDTDTBT |
| PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 6 displays the ln(JL 3 / V 2 ) vs ( V / L ) 0.5 curve for the measurement of the hole mobility of the blend films of PzNDTDTBT / PC71BM ( 1 : 2 , w / w ) and PzNDTDTBO / PC71BM ( 1.5 : 1 , w / w ) by the SCLC method.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. ln(JL 3 / V 2 ) - Ln (Joint Load 3 / Voltage 2)
2. V - Voltage
3. L - Length
4. PzNDTDTBT - Polymer Name (PzNDTDTBT)
5. PC71BM - Polymer Name (PC71BM)
6. w - Weight ratio of the blend films (1 : 2, w/w)
7. 1.5 - Fraction of the blend films (1.5 : 1, w/w)

Note that some of these entities are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but they are listed here only once with their corresponding Property Name labels.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to Material Properties:

1. PzNDTDTBT - Material Name
2. PC71BM - Material Name
3. V - Material Property (Voltage)
4. L - Material Property (Length)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to Material Properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| V | Voltage |
| L | Length |
| PzNDTDTBT | PzNDTDTBT |
| PC71BM | PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 6 displays the ln(JL 3 / V 2 ) vs ( V / L ) 0.5 curve for the measurement of the hole mobility of the blend films of PzNDTDTBT / PC71BM ( 1 : 2 , w / w ) and PzNDTDTBO / PC71BM ( 1.5 : 1 , w / w ) by the SCLC method.

Let's think step by step.

In this paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

1. ln(JL 3 / V 2 ) - the natural logarithm of the current density (J) divided by the voltage (V) squared.
2. ( V / L ) 0.5 - the voltage (V) divided by the length (L) of the blend film.
3. hole mobility - the mobility of holes in the blend films.

These entities are property values because they represent physical quantities that can be measured or calculated from the data presented in the paragraph, such as the current density, voltage, and mobility of the blend films.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph:

1. ln(JL 3 / V 2 ) - the natural logarithm of the current density (J) divided by the voltage (V) squared, which is a measure of the material's electrical conductivity.
2. ( V / L ) 0.5 - the voltage (V) divided by the length (L) of the blend film, which is a measure of the material's electrical conductivity.

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer to the value of material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to the value of material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| ln(JL 3 / V 2 ) |
| ( V / L ) 0.5 |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
